His family would seek to shield the southern kingdoms as northern warlords give in to greed and conflict spills across the land. The offer is reasonable; past grievances and differences be put aside and to keep tyrants of the north from crossing the Yangtze.

dilemmas.localised_description: An envoy is brought before you, a representative of one of the warlords of the south. You have heard of the exploits of Sun Jian, a famed warrior and leader. His family would seek to shield the southern kingdoms as northern warlords give in to greed and conflict spills across the land. The offer is reasonable; past grievances and differences be put aside and to keep tyrants of the north from crossing the Yangtze.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Nanman tribal leaders look down on you for your Han ancestry, whilst the Han treat you with suspicion for your sympathy for the plight of the southern tribes. Some even dare to call you a savage! Now, however, being a son of both worlds, you are in the unique positon of being able to guide the Nanman people towards a better future. It is therefore time for you to choose which path you wish to tread. The world beyond your borders is rife with the violence of avaricious men; if they sense weakness they will not hesitate to take what is yours.

dilemmas.localised_description: Nanman tribal leaders look down on you for your Han ancestry, whilst the Han treat you with suspicion for your sympathy for the plight of the southern tribes. Some even dare to call you a savage! Now, however, being a son of both worlds, you are in the unique positon of being able to guide the Nanman people towards a better future. It is therefore time for you to choose which path you wish to tread. The world beyond your borders is rife with the violence of avaricious men; if they sense weakness they will not hesitate to take what is yours.

localised_description.last_approved_text: King Duosi personally comes before you, respectfully asking for consent to marry your sister. In private discussion, your sister has stated her willingness to the match – Duosi is a good man, and the benefits of a strong ally will serve the people of the five valleys well, potentially unifying them as a stronger whole. As such, she will gladly pay her part to see the tribes succeed.

dilemmas.localised_description: King Duosi personally comes before you, respectfully asking for consent to marry your sister. In private discussion, your sister has stated her willingness to the match – Duosi is a good man, and the benefits of a strong ally will serve the people of the five valleys well, potentially unifying them as a stronger whole. As such, she will gladly pay her part to see the tribes succeed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As news of the expansion of your domain spreads, Duosi comes before you in person. To him your ambitions are clear and, not wanting to make an enemy of you, he instead he proposes to join under your banner, peacefully. It is his belief that if you give proof of a mutually beneficial co-existence that others may choose to do the same.

dilemmas.localised_description: As news of the expansion of your domain spreads, Duosi comes before you in person. To him your ambitions are clear and, not wanting to make an enemy of you, he instead he proposes to join under your banner, peacefully. It is his belief that if you give proof of a mutually beneficial co-existence that others may choose to do the same.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The emperor has decided you are deserving of punishment! Whether it is through your own actions, or due to those who scheme against you in the imperial court, you have been exiled from the Han and declared an enemy to all who still profess their loyalty to Emperor Xian!

dilemmas.localised_description: The emperor has decided you are deserving of punishment! Whether it is through your own actions, or due to those who scheme against you in the imperial court, you have been exiled from the Han and declared an enemy to all who still profess their loyalty to Emperor Xian!

localised_description.last_approved_text:
At your behest, the Confucian scholar, along with several of his students, has journeyed to your court.
 "My teachings are my legacy and the deeds of those who succeed me are the measure of my tutelage.
 I ask that you allow me to match master and disciple, for when both are in harmony there can be no discord. In discord, chaos follows – its corrupting miasma infects the hearts of men."

 Kneeling before you, he asks
 "Of the constant virtues, which makes one best fit to rule?"

dilemmas.localised_description:
At your behest, the Confucian scholar, along with several of his students, has journeyed to your court.
 "My teachings are my legacy and the deeds of those who succeed me are the measure of my tutelage.
 I ask that you allow me to match master and disciple, for when both are in harmony there can be no discord. In discord, chaos follows – its corrupting miasma infects the hearts of men."

 Kneeling before you, he presents you the following question:
 "Of the constant virtues, which makes one best fit to rule?"

localised_description.last_approved_text: The warlords desire your help in fighting the tyrant Dong Zhuo, and they want us to commit part of your forces to assist them in their undertaking. Lord Ma Teng seems particularly keen that you aid his righteous cause.

dilemmas.localised_description: The warlords desire your help in fighting the tyrant Dong Zhuo, and they want us to commit part of your forces to assist them in their undertaking. Lord Ma Teng seems particularly keen that you aid his righteous cause.

localised_description.last_approved_text: One of your advisors comes to you with the idea that you should remove the powerful from your lands, in order to ensure an even stronger hold over it for yourself. This would obviously upset several of the local lords, who might fear for their own positions, but it would shore up your own rule and make it nigh-on unassailable.

dilemmas.localised_description: One of your advisors comes to you with the idea that you should remove the powerful from your lands, in order to ensure an even stronger hold over it for yourself. This would obviously upset several of the local lords, who might fear for their own positions, but it would shore up your own rule and make it nigh-on unassailable.

localised_description.last_approved_text: You are approached by a representative from the east. The messenger expresses Wu's dissatisfaction with Cao Cao’s warmongering, treacherous history and deceitful ways. He presents a choice of gifts to show solidarity with your resistance to him.

dilemmas.localised_description: You are approached by a representative from the east. The messenger expresses Wu's dissatisfaction with Cao Cao’s warmongering, treacherous history and deceitful ways. He presents a choice of gifts to show solidarity with your resistance to him.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Your advisor approaches you with an opportunity to the south. “No doubt Sun Quan will look upon you favorably should you choose to deal with Chen Deng. Reports suggest he has been raiding the southern lands. He also stands as a steadfast ally to Cao Cao – perhaps weakening such an alliance will lead to allies of our own?"

dilemmas.localised_description: Your advisor approaches you with an opportunity to the south. “No doubt Sun Quan will look upon you favorably should you choose to deal with Chen Deng. Reports suggest he has been raiding the southern lands. He also stands as a steadfast ally to Cao Cao – perhaps weakening such an alliance will lead to allies of our own?"

localised_description.last_approved_text: There is no question that these lands would provide a firm haven to begin establishing your dynasty, my lord. The time has come to choose how to deal with the esteemed leader in the west – will they serve our rule or crumble before it?

dilemmas.localised_description: There is no question that these lands would provide a firm haven to begin establishing your dynasty, my lord. The time has come to choose how to deal with the esteemed leader in the west – will they serve our rule or crumble before it?

localised_description.last_approved_text: Zhang Lu used to be one of your subjects before he took up arms and established a region of his own. Although this is not a pressing concern, as his position creates a buffer that enables you to act more freely, but perhaps you should make it clear to him exactly who is charge here?

dilemmas.localised_description: Zhang Lu used to be one of your subjects before he took up arms and established a region of his own. Although this is not a pressing concern, as his position creates a buffer that enables you to act more freely, but perhaps you should make it clear to him exactly who is charge here?

localised_description.last_approved_text: Zhang Lu has tested your patience for the last time. It is time to take action against him, and secure both his lands and riches for ourselves.

dilemmas.localised_description: Zhang Lu has tested your patience for the last time. It is time to take action against him, and secure both his lands and riches for ourselves.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Your heir seems to be in need of some encouragement, or perhaps some stricter guidance, in order to ensure they become the best possible candidate to take over the mantle of ruler once you have gone.

dilemmas.localised_description: Your heir seems to be in need of some encouragement, or perhaps some stricter guidance, in order to ensure they become the best possible candidate to take over the mantle of ruler once you have gone.

localised_description.last_approved_text: My Lord, Liu Fan and Liu Dan have been under the claws of Dong Zhuo as hostages for long enough! As your martial assistance to him has not been openly announced, he has loosened his iron grip, and therefore a unique opportunity to bring them home may have opened up before you. However, since their lives have not been directly threatened, is the amount of effort needed to save them really worth it?

dilemmas.localised_description: My Lord, Liu Fan and Liu Dan have been under the claws of Dong Zhuo as hostages for long enough! As your martial assistance to him has not been openly announced, he has loosened his iron grip, and therefore a unique opportunity to bring them home may have opened up before you. However, since their lives have not been directly threatened, is the amount of effort needed to save them really worth it?

localised_description.last_approved_text: To Cao Cao, there is loyalty or there is nothing. By swearing allegiance to him and his court, you will gain his favour – at least for now. \n\n Will you make such a pledge?

dilemmas.localised_description: To Cao Cao, there is loyalty or there is nothing. By swearing allegiance to him and his court, you will gain his favour – at least for now. \n\n Will you make such a pledge?

localised_title.last_approved_text: Cao Cao Demands Loyalty From Liu Zhang

dilemmas.localised_title: Cao Cao Demands Loyalty From Liu Zhang

localised_description.last_approved_text: An acquaintance comes to visit. After talking of various minor matters, they look serious. \n\n "There is a great man and strategist called Zhuge Liang, the Sleeping Dragon. If you require his assistance, seek him at his nearby home."

dilemmas.localised_description: An acquaintance comes to visit. After talking of various minor matters, they look serious. \n\n "There is a great man and strategist called Zhuge Liang, the Sleeping Dragon. If you require his assistance, seek him at his nearby home."

localised_description.last_approved_text: Ma Chao comes to you, prepared for battle and eager to set out against Cao Cao. There will be no convincing him otherwise – he is determined to make war. He will pledge his blade to you, if you would so wish it. \n\n Do you?

dilemmas.localised_description: Ma Chao comes to you, prepared for battle and eager to set out against Cao Cao. There will be no convincing him otherwise – he is determined to make war. He will pledge his blade to you, if you would so wish it. \n\n Do you?

localised_title.last_approved_text: Ma Chao Takes the Fight to Cao Cao

dilemmas.localised_title: Ma Chao Takes the Fight to Cao Cao

localised_description.last_approved_text: Your scouts have intercepted a missive detailing a large Han expeditionary force planning to imminently attack you. Yet there is no knowledge of where the missive came from; your council believes either Liu Zhang or Shi Xie, but others think it may be an enemy plot to distract us. \n\n As the cloud of confusion grows, they look to you to decide...

dilemmas.localised_description: Your scouts have intercepted a missive detailing a large Han expeditionary force planning to imminently attack you. Yet there is no knowledge of where the missive came from; your council believes either Liu Zhang or Shi Xie, but others think it may be an enemy plot to distract us. \n\n As the cloud of confusion grows, they look to you to decide...

localised_description.last_approved_text: You loyal vassal, Wu Jing, has sadly died. Although he has nominated an heir, you have an opportunity to instead annex his lands for your own designs. Yet this may cause friction with those who believe such acts to lack honour and character. What is your decision?

dilemmas.localised_description: You loyal vassal, Wu Jing, has sadly died. Although he has nominated an heir, you have an opportunity to instead annex his lands for your own designs. Yet this may cause friction with those who believe such acts to lack honour and character. What is your decision?

localised_title.last_approved_text: Wu Jing Has a Funeral and His Lands are Divided

dilemmas.localised_title: Wu Jing Has a Funeral and His Lands are Divided

localised_description.last_approved_text: One of your advisors whispers to you the following plan: Liu Bei has been an ally in the fight against Cao Cao, but he is too concerned about kindness to be an effective tool on his own. Instead, you could use your power and his isolated position to syphon resources away from him, and into your own coffers...

dilemmas.localised_description: One of your advisors whispers to you the following plan: Liu Bei has been an ally in the fight against Cao Cao, but he is too concerned about kindness to be an effective tool on his own. Instead, you could use your power and his isolated position to syphon resources away from him, and into your own coffers...

localised_description.last_approved_text: You have weakened Liu Bei and strengthened yourself. You now have a choice: to put him out of his misery and betray him for good, or perhaps have you been too harsh on him?

dilemmas.localised_description: You have weakened Liu Bei and strengthened yourself. You now have a choice: to put him out of his misery and betray him for good, or perhaps have you been too harsh on him?

localised_description.last_approved_text: Two of your sons bicker and fight over who is the rightful heir. Yuan Tan is the eldest, and by tradition should be picked. However, Yuan Shang is a brilliant commander and charismatic leader. You realise that there is no easy choice to be made here.

dilemmas.localised_description: Two of your sons bicker and fight over who is the rightful heir. Yuan Tan is the eldest, and by tradition should be picked. However, Yuan Shang is a brilliant commander and charismatic leader. You realise that there is no easy choice to be made here.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Upon arrival, your scouts spot the distressed traders frantically trying to repair their carts. They appear helpless, with stragglers spread out further down the road, their carts caught deep in the mud. The goods they're transporting appear to be supplies and equipment bound for Yuan Shao to aid his ongoing war efforts. This is a prime oppertunity to secure some equipment, no doubt such banditry will reflect poorly on us should word reach Yuan Shao about what has happened...

dilemmas.localised_description: Upon arrival, your scouts spot the distressed traders frantically trying to repair their carts. They appear helpless, with stragglers spread out further down the road, their carts caught deep in the mud. The goods they're transporting appear to be supplies and equipment bound for Yuan Shao to aid his ongoing war efforts. This is a prime oppertunity to secure some equipment, no doubt such banditry will reflect poorly on us should word reach Yuan Shao about what has happened...

localised_description.last_approved_text:
When the blood rises for war, there is little that can calm the boiling fury – yet you can direct the channel of their passions: 

 Cao Cao has both fertile lands, and a distracted army, so may present a potent opportunity. However, Liu Bei is weak, and his allies are spread thin; he may be ready to fall. 

 The choice is yours – where shall you strike?

dilemmas.localised_description:
When the blood rises for war, there is little that can calm the boiling fury – yet you can direct the channel of their passions: 

 Cao Cao has both fertile lands, and a distracted army, so may present a potent opportunity. However, Liu Bei is weak, and his allies are spread thin; he may be ready to fall. 

 The choice is yours – where shall you strike?

Tian Feng, unhappy that you ignored his advice not to attack Cao Cao, has been reportedly bad-mouthing you to other ministers, behind you back. If this sedition continues, unabated, the morale of the troops will be sorely affected.

Two of your ministers have both raised valid plans on how to proceed. One feels that you should attack Cao Cao's supply lines, while the other states that you should use your superior forces to crush Cao Cao in a pincer attack. You could of course ignore both of them...
With Yuan Shao and Cao Cao coming to blows in the north, your advisors clamour that this is your chance to break free of his tyranny. Do you follow their advice?

Your power in the north continues to rise, but across the river lies the domain of Cao Cao. While he was your one time friend, the increase in troops along your borders can no longer be ignored. Is now the time to snuff him out?

Your new minister, Xu You seems a man of great talent. He mentions that a strike against Yuan Shao's supply lines would cripple his forces. He will point out a region holding the majority of Yuan Shao's supplies, if you agree to muster your forces against it.

Ju Shou comes to you in a state of some distress. He has been looking over the reports and states that he thinks our supply lines are at risk from Cao Cao's forces. While he understands that we are at war, to lose those supplies could spell our defeat.

You enter the council chamber to find Zhang He and Guo Tu shouting across the aisle. Zhang He believes that your supply lines are in grave danger, but Guo Tu dismisses his claims as baseless paranoia. He suggest that since we are so advantaged, we should simply strike at Cao Cao.
dilemmas.localised_title: Zhang He argues with Guo Tu

dilemmas.localised_description: The choice is yours to make. Restore the emperor to his throne, or take it for yourself?

localised_description.last_approved_text: From the ashes of the battlefield, a horse is brought before you. It belonged to the enemy general and he was seen to be killed by an unfortunate accident whilst riding it. Its skin a dappled grey and, on its head, a small white dot. \n\n One of your advisors reels in horror, stating that this horse is surely cursed and you should not take it.

dilemmas.localised_description: From the ashes of the battlefield, a horse is brought before you. It belonged to the enemy general and he was seen to be killed by an unfortunate accident whilst riding it. Its skin a dappled grey and, on its head, a small white dot. \n\n One of your advisors reels in horror, stating that this horse is surely cursed and you should not take it.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Our patrols have captured a group of bandits operating nearby. One of their number, claiming to have found the error of their ways, has asked to join our esteemed faction.

dilemmas.localised_description: Our patrols have captured a group of bandits operating nearby. One of their number, claiming to have found the error of their ways, has asked to join our esteemed faction.

localised_description.last_approved_text: While resettling the people, your attendant comes upon an issue and requests your judgement. A couple, living in the local area, have refused to move, claiming that this has been their home for generations. What should he do?

dilemmas.localised_description: While resettling the people, your attendant comes upon an issue and requests your judgement. A couple, living in the local area, have refused to move, claiming that this has been their home for generations. What should he do?

localised_description.last_approved_text: Your attendant reports that their investigation into local corruption has exposed profiteering all the way to the top. They suspect the administrator of the commandery to be a source of the current issues. They also recommend that rather than removing them, you perhaps whisper some words in their ear as to the fate of traitors.

dilemmas.localised_description: Your attendant reports that their investigation into local corruption has exposed profiteering all the way to the top. They suspect the administrator of the commandery to be a source of the current issues. They also recommend that rather than removing them, you perhaps whisper some words in their ear as to the fate of traitors.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Whilst at a lavish feast, an argument erupts between two of your followers; one decries the other's frugality, gesturing to the vast food on offer and imploring him to eat more. The other suggests that "gluttony speaks to a mind in chaos". \n\n The two seem quite intractable...

dilemmas.localised_description: Whilst at a lavish feast, an argument erupts between two of your followers; one decries the other's frugality, gesturing to the vast food on offer and imploring him to eat more. The other suggests that "gluttony speaks to a mind in chaos". \n\n The two seem quite intractable...

localised_description.last_approved_text: You are reading philosophy, and are particularly engrossed by a passage on ambition. The tree, it says, shall always strive heavenward, yet also argues that others - pretenders - should bow beneath the resplendent canopy. You pause a moment to consider...

dilemmas.localised_description: You are reading philosophy, and are particularly engrossed by a passage on ambition. The tree, it says, shall always strive heavenward, yet also argues that others - pretenders - should bow beneath the resplendent canopy. You pause a moment to consider...

localised_description.last_approved_text:
As you walk through the courtyard, you overhear two soldiers bickering. One claims that he can hit a target from over 150 metres. 

 "500 chi?" the other cries. "That's nothing! I can hit a target from 900 chi! Blindfolded!" 

 They continue to argue as you observe...

dilemmas.localised_description:
As you walk through the courtyard, you overhear two soldiers bickering. One claims that he can hit a target from over 150 metres. 

 "500 chi?" the other cries. "That's nothing! I can hit a target from 900 chi! Blindfolded!" 

 They continue to argue as you observe...

localised_description.last_approved_text:
Your peaceful meditation is disturbed by an angry discussion between two of your retainers happening nearby. You listen to the argument. 

 "As a bastion of honour, I cannot allow this to stand! You have taken [[b]]countless[[/b]] bribes for army rations!" says the first. 

 "If you want, I can involve you," argues the second. "How does half sound...?" 

They are unaware you are listening...

dilemmas.localised_description:
Your peaceful meditation is disturbed by an angry discussion between two of your retainers happening nearby. You listen to the argument. 

 "As a bastion of honour, I cannot allow this to stand! You have taken [[b]]countless[[/b]] bribes for army rations!" says the first. 

 "If you want, I can involve you," argues the second. "How does half sound...?" 

They are unaware you are listening...

localised_description.last_approved_text:
As you are inspecting the defences, you are disrupted by an argument between two officers. 

 "You are a coward unlike any other!" cries the first. "I saw you fleeting like a lamb! I saw you!" 

 "I was not!" states the second. "And even so, it's better to survive a coward than die a meathead and a fool!" 

 They do not even seem to notice you...

dilemmas.localised_description:
As you are inspecting the defences, you are disrupted by an argument between two officers. 

 "You are a coward unlike any other!" cries the first. "I saw you fleeting like a lamb! I saw you!" 

 "I was not!" states the second. "And even so, it's better to survive a coward than die a meathead and a fool!" 

 They do not even seem to notice you...

localised_description.last_approved_text:
Once again, your harmonious afternoon is disturbed by the clamour of disagreement. 

 "This is impossible!" one cries. "I cannot work with this idiot! Bring me a monkey; that would at least be entertaining!" 

 "You are an oaf as well as rude!" snaps the second. "You only know I am a fool because you are a fool, too!" 

 Their argument rages on...

dilemmas.localised_description:
Once again, your harmonious afternoon is disturbed by the clamour of disagreement. 

 "This is impossible!" one cries. "I cannot work with this idiot! Bring me a monkey; that would at least be entertaining!" 

 "You are an oaf as well as rude!" snaps the second. "You only know I am a fool because you are a fool, too!" 

 Their argument rages on...

localised_description.last_approved_text:
As you take tea in the afternoon, you are interrupted by two arguing officers. They decry one another to you. 

 "He rushes into everything! Last week he led his battalion to the nearby river. Everything was soaked!" states the first. 

 "If we did things your way, we'd never leave the camp at all!" argues the second. 

 Your tea goes cold...

dilemmas.localised_description:
As you take tea in the afternoon, you are interrupted by two arguing officers. They decry one another to you. 

 "He rushes into everything! Last week he led his battalion to the nearby river. Everything was soaked!" states the first. 

 "If we did things your way, we'd never leave the camp at all!" argues the second. 

 Your tea goes cold...

localised_description.last_approved_text:
Whilst at dinner, a muffled argument breaks out between two guests. 

 "All I did was invite you to dine with us - you know, we actually talk from time-to-time!" says the first. 

 "I [[b]]did[[/b]] politely decline, I just prefer my own company to that of others. I mean no offence!" argues the second. 

 They do not notice you observing them...

dilemmas.localised_description:
Whilst at dinner, a muffled argument breaks out between two guests. 

 "All I did was invite you to dine with us - you know, we actually talk from time-to-time!" says the first. 

 "I [[b]]did[[/b]] politely decline, I just prefer my own company to that of others. I mean no offence!" argues the second. 

 They do not notice you observing them...

localised_description.last_approved_text:
Whilst on a stroll, you come across two men having a discussion-turned-argument. They entreat you. 

 "Both halves of a divided orange will taste just as good," posits the first, "but [[b]]this one[[/b]] just takes the whole orange! It's intolerable!" 

 "I take what is rightfully mine!" argues the second. 

 Their spat is somewhat amusing...

dilemmas.localised_description:
Whilst on a stroll, you come across two men having a discussion-turned-argument. They entreat you. 

 "Both halves of a divided orange will taste just as good," posits the first, "but [[b]]this one[[/b]] just takes the whole orange! It's intolerable!" 

 "I take what is rightfully mine!" argues the second. 

 Their spat is somewhat amusing...

localised_description.last_approved_text:
The sound of an exchange between two courtiers breaks you from a thoughtful reverie. 

 "Hey! You've left your robes open! We can see [[b]]everything[[/b]]," says the first. 

 "Oh no! Really!?" He is red-faced and bashful. "How embarr--hold on! You scoundrel, stop lying!" 

 The other courtiers seem amused by this exchange...

dilemmas.localised_description:

 "Hey! You've left your robes open! We can see [[b]]everything[[/b]]," says the first. 

 "Oh no! Really!?" He is red-faced and bashful. "How embarr--hold on! You scoundrel, stop lying!" 

 The other courtiers seem amused by this exchange...

localised_description.last_approved_text:
You are observing a battalion drilling when you notice two warriors competing. 

 "You first!" one cries, offering his bow. 

 "No! You first!" the other replies, through gritted teeth. 

 As they argue, the entire battalion turns to watch…
